title: Good substitute for Bodoni Antigua Demi Bold?
content:
My French design counterpart just sent me an ID file that uses Bodoni Antigua Demi Bold. Any suggestions for a replacement font (cheap or free)? I don’t like to make changes to someone else’s design work, but I don’t want to skip lunch this month to purchase the Bodoni font package.

Thanks,

Tad

 [‹ KICKOFF](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906211602/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46175 "Go to previous forum topic") [FREE STYLE ROMAN LETTERING ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906211602/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46892 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dementad

comments.content:
Hi Tad,

there are hundreds of [Bodoni fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906211602/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/atf-bodoni/familytree.html) out there, and the ‘Anti **q** ua Demi Bold’ doesn’t really help that much.

However, there’s [an URW version by that name](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906211602/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/bodoni-antiqua/t-demi-bold/) for a mere $19.95.  
F
